timeline.message: [GEOS-9443] Search and replace abilities for style editor

timeline.bodyText: As per https://defkey.com/codemirror-shortcuts, this is Cmd-Option-F on Mac (Tested locally)
timeline.author: tbarsballe
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -140,6 +140,12 @@ The style editor supports line numbering, automatic indentation, and real-time s
      - Redo
    * - .. image:: img/styles_editor_goto.png
      - Go to line
+   * - .. image:: img/styles_editor_find.png
+     - Find in style text (CTRL-F)
+   * - .. image:: img/styles_editor_find_next.png
+     - Find next occurrence in style text (CTRL-G)
+   * - .. image:: img/styles_editor_replace.png
+     - Find and replace in style text (CTRL-SHIFT-F)

timeline.bodyText: Any reason you are using the full name for these and not just using the relative name or a static import?
timeline.author: tbarsballe

replies.bodyText: Ah sorry, this is, while useful, unrelated. Should back it out and add in a separate commit.
replies.author: aaime

timeline.bodyText: Since these all use an href of #, clicking any of them jumps you to the top of the page, which doesn't work all that well when using them (since it can scroll the current result of the page) Adding an anchor element, e.g. just above the button elements, and changing each href="#" to href="#style-editor" should make this work a bit better.
timeline.author: tbarsballe
timeline.diffHunk: @@ -70,6 +70,15 @@ + + + + + + + + +

replies.bodyText: Found out that using "#a" works equally well, the page does not move around. Applied to all buttons.

timeline.bodyText: These two use CMD-* on OS X (I tried it out, CTRL doesn't work), which should be indicated, e.g. (CTRL-F or CMD-F on Mac)

timeline.bodyText: I found the actual operation of the replace function a bit unintuitive to use - I'm used to having "Replace" and "With" together in the same dialog. A doc note indicating that "Enter" lets you set the "With" is probably a good idea.
